chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = y

Premises:
leZ = fun x y : Z => match x with | OZ => match y with | neg _ => False | _ => True end | pos n => match y with | pos m => n <= m | _ => False end | neg n => match y with | neg m => m <= n | _ => True end end : Z -> Z -> Prop
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
le_opp_OZ : forall x y : Z, x = oppZ y -> leZ OZ x -> leZ OZ y -> x = OZ
le_opp_OZ_l : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> leZ (oppZ x) OZ
tech_le_pos_abs : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> absZ x = x
ltZ = fun x y : Z => leZ (succZ x) y : Z -> Z -> Prop
leZ_antisymmetric = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => leZ x0 y -> leZ y x0 -> x0 = y) (Z_ind (fun y0 : Z => leZ OZ y0 -> leZ y0 OZ -> OZ = y0) (fun _ _ : leZ OZ OZ => eq_refl) (fun (n : nat) (_ : leZ OZ (pos n)) (H0 : leZ (pos n) OZ) => False_ind (OZ = pos n) H0) (fun (n : nat) (H : leZ OZ (neg n)) (_ : leZ (neg n) OZ) => False_ind (OZ = neg n) H) y) (fun n : nat => Z_ind (fun y0 : Z => leZ (pos n) y0 -> leZ y0 (pos n) -> pos n = y0) (fun (H : leZ (pos n) OZ) (_ : leZ OZ (pos n)) => False_ind (pos n = OZ) H...
BinInt.Z.eq_stepl : forall x y z : BinNums.Z, x = y -> x = z -> z = y
Nat.eq_stepl : forall x y z : nat, x = y -> x = z -> z = y
sign_absZ : forall x : Z, leZ OZ (absZ x)
PreOmega.Z.rem_0_r_ext : forall x y : BinNums.Z, y = BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.rem x y = x
BinInt.Z.compare_eq : forall x y : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.compare x y = Eq -> x = y
Byte.byte_dec_bl : forall x y : Byte.byte, Byte.eqb x y = true -> x = y
Eqdep_dec.inj_right_pair_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall (P : A -> Prop) (y y' : P x), ex_intro P x y = ex_intro P x y' -> y = y'
Byte.eqb_false : forall x y : Byte.byte, Byte.eqb x y = false -> x <> y
addZ_eq1 : forall y : Z, addZ OZ y = y
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_on : forall (A : Type) (x : A), (forall y : A, x = y \/ x <> y) -> forall P : x = x -> Prop, P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
EqdepFacts.internal_eq_rew_r_dep : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (P : forall y0 : A, y0 = y -> Type), P y eq_refl -> forall H : x = y, P x H
Computational : forall (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (reqb : R -> R -> bool), (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> ring_kind
EqdepFacts.UIP_shift_on : forall (X : Type) (x : X), EqdepFacts.UIP_refl_on_ X x -> forall y : x = x, EqdepFacts.UIP_refl_on_ (x = x) y
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.gt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
VectorEq.eqb_eq : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), VectorEq.eqb A A_beq v1 v2 = true < -> v1 = v2
BinInt.Z.eq_sym_iff : forall x y : BinNums.Z, x = y < -> y = x
succ_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (succZ x) y = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_l : forall x y : Z, addZ (predZ x) y = predZ (addZ x y)
Eqdep_dec.K_dec_type : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (x : A) (P : x = x -> Prop), P eq_refl -> forall p : x = x, P p
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.divmod_spec : forall x y q u : nat, u <= y -> let (q', u') := Nat.divmod x y q u in x + S y * q + (y - u) = S y * q' + (y - u') /\ u' <= y
add_OZ : forall x : Z, addZ x OZ = x
succ_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (succZ y) = succZ (addZ x y)
pred_addZ_r : forall x y : Z, addZ x (predZ y) = predZ (addZ x y)
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Eqdep_dec.eq_rect_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (p : A) (Q : A -> Type) (x : Q p) (h : p = p), x = eq_rect p Q x p h
lt_absZ = fun x y : Z => ltZ (absZ x) (absZ y) : Z -> Z -> Prop
abs_eq_or_oppZ : forall x : Z, {absZ x = x} + {absZ x = oppZ x}
tech_posOZ_pos : forall n : nat, leZ OZ (posOZ n)

```coq
intros x y H1 H2 H3.
rewrite <- H1.
apply le_opp_OZ.
apply H2.
apply H3.
Qed.```
